attributes.action: Formally regulate the use of direct marketing telephone calls.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The use of direct telemarketing, intrudes into the time and privacy of the public, and can destroy their peace of mind.

The Telephone Preference service is beholden to the marketing industry as such the TPS is toothless as it would be against the interests of its masters if it was effective.

We ask therefore that Ofcom directly police the use of telemarketing, and that parliament legislate to properly prosecute and punish offenders

As a minimum this should include 
i.)to ban the use of systems that generate more calls than there are operators to take them. These systems often result in repeated silent calls which can cause distress.
ii.)That those organisations that use direct calls be banned from with holding their numbers.
iii.)That  services such as call barring which may be required by individuals who have suffered from unwanted calls be paid for from a levy on these organisations.
iv.)That companys that persist in making unwanted calls or who refuse to abide by rules on good practise be punished effectively, given that they have not responded to the threat financial fines, this punishment should take the form of being barred from ever using a telephone again.

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with OFCOM.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
